message_2:
To factor the polynomial expression x^3 - 3x^2 + 2x, first look for a common factor among all the terms. In this case, the common factor is x. 

Factor out the x:

x(x^2 - 3x + 2)

Now, we need to factor the quadratic expression inside the parentheses:

x^2 - 3x + 2 can be factored as (x - 1)(x - 2)

So, the factored form of the polynomial expression is:

x(x - 1)(x - 2)
